name: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione consists of a piperazine ring with two carbonyl groups and an ethyl group. The piperazine ring has a melting point around 106°C. The carbonyl groups increase the melting point due to their ability to form hydrogen bonds, which might raise the melting point by approximately +10°C each. However, the ethyl substitution tends to lower the melting point compared to piperazine, as it creates a more asymmetric structure, reducing the crystal lattice stability, which might decrease the melting point by approximately -10°C. Summing up these changes: Piperazine base (+106°C), two carbonyl groups (+20°C), and one ethyl group (-10°C).
